plugins.name: Easy Docs
plugins.description:
Watch the demo!

Easy Docs is an open-source Figma plugin, that helps you manage documentation easily!

Features

Easy Docs lets you:

  1. Write documentation quickly with its live Editor.
  2. Generate component specs quickly with support for Design Tokens
  3. Export your documentation to a markdown, HTML, or JSON file.
  4. Copy your documentation as rich text that can seamlessly be pasted into Notion, Google Docs, Confluence, Supernova, and many more.
  5. Generate a full-fledge documentation site that can be hosted anywhere you need!
plugins.tagline: Import, manage and export documentation to Notion, Google Docs, Confluence, HTML, Markdown and JSON

plugins.name: View Overrides

This plugin allows you to get an overview of overrides in your layers.

plugins.name: Pushed.ai - Figma to Klaviyo
plugins.description:
Try Pushed Out In Our Playground File


Streamline Your Email Workflow with Our Figma-to-Klaviyo Plugin


Simplify email development by exporting production-ready HTML directly from Figma to Klaviyo. Say goodbye to switching between tools—now you can design, configure, and build beautiful, responsive emails all in one place. Whether you're working on email templates or full campaigns, our plugin helps you spend less time navigating Klaviyo and more time creating.


How the Plugin Works:

  1. Design in Figma: Start by crafting your email design using frames and components in Figma.
  2. Sync with Klaviyo: Effortlessly link your Klaviyo account and configure your campaign with built-in audience and account selection features.
  3. Configure Campaign Details: Add campaign names, audience segments, subject lines, preview text directly in the plugin.
  4. Optimize for Responsiveness: Automatically pull alt text from Figma frames and easily configure URLs for each frame to ensure accessibility and responsiveness.
  5. Export to Klaviyo: With one click, export your email template or campaign to Klaviyo, fully ready to schedule and send.


Key Benefits 

Stay Inside Figma—No Switching Tools

Our plugin keeps you inside Figma, allowing you to handle everything from design to export. No need for back-and-forth between Figma and Klaviyo—design, configure, and export all in one seamless workflow.


Seamless Klaviyo Integration

Quickly integrate with your Klaviyo account to manage multiple accounts and campaigns without ever leaving Figma. Set up your email campaigns in just a few clicks.


Responsive & Accessible by Design

Exported emails are automatically mobile-friendly and accessible. Our plugin pulls alt text directly from your Figma frames and uses HTML to enhance readability for screen readers, ensuring your emails are optimized for all devices and email clients.


Efficient Campaign Setup

Configure every aspect of your email campaigns—from audience lists to subject lines—and export HTML directly into Klaviyo. With unnecessary steps cut out, you can create professional emails in minutes instead of hours.


Designed for Creators, Loved by Marketers

We understand both design and marketing. Our plugin is built to support you in creating stunning, effective emails quickly and easily—without compromising on creativity or functionality.


Get Support from:

For any questions, reach out to us at support@pushed.ai
plugins.tagline: Design, optimize, and export stunning emails from Figma to Klaviyo—seamlessly and effortlessly.

plugins.name: Batch Frame Creator
plugins.description:
Effortlessly create and customize Figma frames with specified dimensions and names using this plugin.


Introducing my latest plugin, a personal endeavor aimed at streamlining frame creation like never before. With just a single click, you can now batch-create an infinite number of frames, significantly reducing the time and effort required compared to traditional methods.


Key Features:


  • Unlimited frame creation
  • Optional frame naming for precise organization
  • Customizable frame sizes (height and width)
  • How to Use:


Upon opening the plugin, you'll find two sections of settings:


Frame Settings:


  • Specify the number of frames you wish to add.
  • Optionally name each frame for meticulous management.


Size Settings:


  • Set the width and height for all frames simultaneously.


Please Note: In this version, size adjustments apply universally to all frames.


I'm open to your suggestions and eager to hear about any additional features you'd like to see or modifications you suggest. Your feedback is invaluable to me, so please don't hesitate to reach out or comment.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly create and customize Figma frames with specified dimensions and names using this plugin

plugins.name: Find all instances and export
plugins.description:
The "Find All Component Instances" plugin is your new dev handoff tool for easily getting the all components you use in any page in Figma. This plugin enables you to easily search, list, and differentiate between instances within your projects.


Key features include:


Instance Detection: Automatically scan and find all instances of components in the current page or selected screens.


Component Differentiation: Use tags like [ds-component] and [ds-atom] in your component descriptions to filter and differentiate design system components.


Search Functionality: Quickly search for components within the current page or across selected screens.


Export to CSV: Export the list of component instances, including details like type, source, and design system status, to a CSV file for further analysis and reporting.


Selection and Highlighting: Easily select and highlight instances in your design to review and manage them effectively.


Whether you're maintaining a large design system or working on a smaller project, this plugin helps you list down all components that you use in any page you are in.


I'd love to hear your thoughts! If you enjoy using the plugin, please take a moment to leave me a review and share your feedback.
plugins.tagline: Eeasily list/export the all components you use in any page in Figma

plugins.name: SVG Sprite Maker
plugins.description:
Description

The SVG Sprite and TypeScript Enum Generator plugin for Figma helps streamline your workflow by automating the process of converting SVG icons into a single sprite sheet and generating corresponding TypeScript enum code. This plugin is designed for developers and designers who want to optimize their projects with efficient SVG handling and seamless TypeScript integration.


Features

SVG Sprite Generation: Automatically compile multiple SVG icons into a single sprite sheet.

TypeScript Enum Generation: Generate TypeScript enum code corresponding to the SVG icons for easy reference in your codebase.

User-friendly Interface: Intuitive and easy-to-use interface for quick and efficient sprite and enum generation.


How to use


// SVGIcons.tsx
type SVGIconProps = {
icon: SVGIcons
width: number
height: number
active: boolean
}

/**
* Renders an SVG icon.
* The SVGSprite.tsx file must be declared at the top level of the project page.
* @param {SVGIcons} props.icon - The name of the icon to render.
* @param {number} props.width - The width of the SVG element.
* @param {number} props.height - The height of the SVG element.
* @returns {JSX.Element} The rendered SVG icon.
*/
const SVGIcon = ({
icon,
width,
height,
...rest // Rest operator to capture additional props
}: Partial<SVGIconProps>): JSX.Element => {
return (
<svg height={height} width={width} {...rest}>
<use
height={height}
href={`#${icon}`}
width={width}
xlinkHref={`#${icon}`}
/>
</svg>
)
}
export default SVGIcon

// SVGSprite.tsx
export enum SVGIcons {
SAMPLE_ICON = 'sample_icon',
}

const SVGSprite = () => {
return (
<svg style={{ display: 'none' }} xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
<defs>
<symbol
height="24"
id="sample_icon"
viewBox="0 0 24 24"
width="24"
>
<path
d="M17.6 4H6.4C5 4 4 5 4 6.4V17.6C4 19 5 20 6.4 20H17.6C19 20 20 19 20 17.6V6.4C20 5 19 4 17.6 4Z"
fill="white"
/>
<path
clipRule="evenodd"
d="M6.4 2H17.6C20.1 2 22 3.9 22 6.4V17.6C22 20.1 20.1 22 17.6 22H6.4C3.9 22 2 20.1 2 17.6V6.4C2 3.9 3.9 2 6.4 2ZM6.4 4H17.6C19 4 20 5 20 6.4V17.6C20 19 19 20 17.6 20H6.4C5 20 4 19 4 17.6V6.4C4 5 5 4 6.4 4Z"
fill="#E5E8EB"
fillRule="evenodd"
/>
<circle cx="15.75" cy="8.5" fill="#FFC342" r="2" />
<path
d="M11.27 11.25C11.66 10.84 12.31 10.84 12.71 11.25L17.51 16.23C17.97 16.71 17.63 17.5 16.97 17.5H7C6.34 17.5 6 16.71 6.46 16.23L11.27 11.25Z"
fill="#03B26C"
/>
</symbol>
</defs>
</svg>
)
}

export default SVGSprite

// use
// Before using the <SVGIcon /> component, you must first call the <SVGSprite /> component in the global scope.
<SVGIcon height={20} icon={SVGIcons.SAMPLE_ICON} width={20} />
plugins.tagline: SVG Sprite and TypeScript Enum Generator

plugins.name: Design Checker
plugins.description:
# Design Checker 3.0 for Figma


**Smart design validation with platform-aware recommendations**


Design Checker 3.0 brings intelligent analysis to your Figma workflow. The plugin now understands whether you're designing for mobile, tablet, or desktop and provides relevant suggestions for each platform.


## What's New in Version 3.0


### 🎯 **Platform Detection**

- Automatically detects mobile, tablet, or desktop designs based on frame width

- Shows platform-specific recommendations instead of generic advice

- Visual indicator shows which platform was detected


### ⚙️ **Customizable Analysis**

- Turn analysis categories on/off based on your project needs

- Choose between strict or flexible Material Design compliance

- Tabs automatically hide when categories are disabled


### 📱 **Better Mobile Support**

- Mobile-specific touch target recommendations

- Thumb zone analysis for mobile interfaces

- Mobile-first accessibility checks


### 🎨 **Improved Interface**

- Streamlined header with integrated search

- Advanced search by measurements, colors, fonts, and object types

- Better filtering and organization


## Key Features


**Design System Validation**

- Grid alignment and spacing consistency

- Typography and color system compliance

- Component sizing and layout checks


**Accessibility & Standards**

- WCAG 2.2 touch target validation

- Material Design 3 guidelines (optional)

- SEO-friendly content hierarchy


**Performance Optimization**

- Core Web Vitals considerations

- Image sizing and layout stability

- Performance impact warnings


## Who Should Use This


- **UI/UX Designers** working on responsive designs

- **Design Teams** maintaining consistency across platforms

- **Mobile-First Projects** requiring platform-specific validation

- **Accessibility-Focused Teams** ensuring inclusive design


## How It Works


1. Select any frame or component in Figma

2. Plugin automatically detects your design platform

3. Get instant, relevant feedback for your specific context

4. Customize which checks to run through settings

5. Fix issues with actionable, platform-aware suggestions


## Why Upgrade to 3.0


- **Smarter Recommendations**: Get advice that matches your actual design context

- **Save Time**: Focus on issues that matter for your platform

- **Better Mobile UX**: Ensure your mobile designs meet usability standards

- **Flexible Analysis**: Only run the checks you need for your project


---


**Ready to improve your design validation process?**


Install Design Checker 3.0 and experience smarter, context-aware design analysis.
plugins.tagline: design checker

plugins.name: Arc Type
plugins.description:
Main Function: Arc-shaped text generation.

Simple operation, fast execution, scientifically designed parameters.


Operation Instructions:


  1. Open the plugin
  2. Select a text layer
  3. Click the "Generate" button and wait briefly for arc text creation
  4. Adjust parameters as needed


Parameter Explanation:


Radian: Adjusts the arc curvature (e.g., 360° = full circle, 180° = semicircle)

Radius: Adjusts the arc radius. You can input values or drag near the input box to modify values, offering convenient operation.

Size: Adjusts font size (adds/subtracts from the original size, allows mixed font sizes).

Vertical Flip icon: Adjusts the arc bending direction (inward or outward).

Outset: Adjusts the starting point of the arc (arc orientation).


Features:

  1. Supports mixed fonts, font weights, colors, and font sizes, as well as font strokes.
  2. Allows secondary editing after generating the arc text.
  3. Supports real-time adjustment and preview.
plugins.tagline: Arc-shaped text generation.

plugins.name: Falcon
plugins.description:
Falcon is an experimental ChatGPT powered Figma plugin that allows you to quickly search for layers using natural language descriptions.


Simply make a selection, then describe a condition that each layer has to follow to remain selected. The plugin will apply that filter to every layer you've selected, and optionally to every child as well, streamlining your workflow and saving you time.


No one likes searching through layers to manually select a bunch of layers in a messy figma file. Now you don't have to.


You'll just need an OpenAI API key to get started, which you can get here after making an account.


Tips:

  • Be descriptive: It's more likely to get you what you want if you're descriptive and specific. It's powered by ChatGPT so if you've used that before, write in a similar way.
  • It doesn't know what you've selected: As a measure to both increase privacy and reduce token usage, I've built it to not rely on knowing what you've got selected, so don't write any rules that expect it to have that understanding. For example, don't write "is the name of an animal" (I tried it once to see what would happen and it tried to make a list of every animal to make a comparison, and it hit the token limit so didn't finish.)
  • It does some things really well, and other things not at all: It currently struggles with vague references to colors and gradients. If you want to query those, be specific, i.e. don't say "is red", instead use a hex code, list of hex codes/rgba/hsla etc or describe a range of values that should pass. For gradients, "has a gradient" doesn't work reliably. Instead, say something like "has a linear gradient fill".


This is still very much an experimental plugin, so expect it to not work perfectly every single time. My twitter DMs are open if you encounter any issues though.
plugins.tagline: Filter and select layers by describing what you want

plugins.name: Flow Export PDF
plugins.description:
Easily export multiple Figma frames into a single PDF with clickable links! 🚀


How to Use:

1. Run the Plugin: Open the "uiexport" plugin.

2. Select Frames: Click and drag or Shift+click to select the frames you want to include in your PDF on the Figma canvas. 🖼️ The plugin window will show how many frames are selected.

3. Start Export: Click the "Export X Pages" button in the plugin window. ▶️

4. Processing: Wait while the plugin exports each frame and combines them into a PDF. You can track the progress (%) and see the status of each page (Exporting..., Processing PDF..., Completed). ⏳⚙️

5. Download: Once finished, the "Download PDF" button will appear. Click it to save your PDF file! 💾✅


✨ Features:

→ Exports multiple selected frames into one PDF.

→ Preserves clickable links (both URLs and links between exported frames). 🔗

→ Shows detailed progress and status for each frame.

→ Simple and clear interface.


Export your prototypes or presentations with interactive links effortlessly!
plugins.tagline: Interactive PDF exporter with multiple frames and clickable links.

plugins.name: i18n with variables
plugins.description:
i18n with variables plugin can help you establish a Translation Management or Content Review System right within Figma with Figma String variable.


Problems to solve

One useful use case for Figma String variable is design localization or content review (like mentioned in this Youtube video) , but they come with certain drawbacks that this plugin aims to solve.

  1. Creating variables, and attaching variables to text layers is very time consuming for a large design file or a complex prototype
  2. Difficulty in identifying text layers that are without attached variables later on
  3. Not easy to create variables in bulk


Features

  1. Display all visible text under a Figma layer as an editable table
  2. Create and assign variables for each text with ease
  3. Auto create variables in bulk
  4. Search and filter the table to quickly identify a text layer that needs to be assigned a new or existing variable
  5. Import and export the text and variables
  6. Remove unused variables


Playground file

Please see the playground file for more tutorials!


Contact

If you have any questions or feature suggestions, feel free to leave a comment!
plugins.tagline: Easily establish a local Translation Management or Content Review System with Figma variables

plugins.name: Copy That
plugins.description:
Manage your copy magically using Figma Variables.


We've all been there.

Your developer looks at the android and iOS versions of your screen, and tells you the copy doesn't match the web version. It should. You would normally despair as you painstakingly update each text layer individually and pray you didn't miss something else.


Despair NO MORE!


This plugin will help your copy stay in sync between screens, and makes updating that copy a breeze!


Import text as Figma variables right from your Figma frames. Then link other text layers to those variables so that when you update that variable, all your text layers get updated automatically and never go out of sync.


This does NOT require a paid version of Figma - will work with the free version.


Happy Figma-ing!


Brad

accepted.name: Brad Judd
accepted.description: I'm a designer at Turo. Always tinkering.

plugins.tagline: Your brain for managing copy in Figma

plugins.name: Frame Multiplier with Custom Text
plugins.description:
With this plugin you will be able to generate n Frames from a "Frame template", in addition you will be able to establish different text values for each one of these.


It is recommended that before executing the plugin, clear names are established for the text fields that they want to modify, so that their identification is easy (step 2), each value goes on a line within the textarea.


If you set a number of values greater than 1 for more than one text field, then they must have the same number of values or lines.


With this plugin you will be able to:

plugins.name: Generate HEX, JSON and Import Styles to Figma
plugins.description:
Effortlessly convert solid-colored shapes to HEX codes, generate stunning color scales, and import/export styles as JSON for seamless collaboration. Crafted with 💗 from Nepal, it’s designed to make your creative journey smoother and more efficient. Try it today and elevate your Figma experience!


  1. Generate HEX Code: Select the solid colored shapes and hit the button to extract color codes just below the shape.
  2. Extract Colors: Select the solid colored shape and hit the button to display the respective color scale from 50,100,200 to 950, from light to dark. You can input the Scale Name for naming the style as a group
  3. Generate JSON: To generate JSON code in key value pairs, where keys will be the color scales and values will be HEX codes
  4. Import JSON Style: To import the extracted colors to the local style in Figma. Importing JSON directly to Figma local style


Constraints: For correct order of color scales, you have to first arrange the shapes from light to dark in ascending order.


Limitations:

  1. Generating color scales/weights below the HEX Code.


Usecase: Design system/Style guides

plugins.name: Cite
plugins.description:
The Cite plugin allows you to add citations from Zotero to your Figma files and FigJam boards. You must have a Zotero account, an API Key, and be online to use the plugin.


To search your private libraries, you'll need to provide the plugin your Zotero User ID and API Key.


Once you’ve added your keys, you can search for anything in your Zotero library. The plugin will return a list of titles and authors. You can select an item from the search results and add it to your layout.


How to use


1. Get your User ID

  • Go to zotero.org/settings/keys and copy your userid. Run the plugin and paste your userid into the plugin’s User ID field.


2. Create an API Key

  • Go back to zotero.org/settings/keys and click “Create new private key”.
  • Fill out the form. Make sure “Allow library access” and “Read Only” are enabled. Click “Save Key.”
  • Copy the key from the green box. Paste the key into the plugin’s API Key field. Click the “Save Keys” button in the plugin.


3. Search your Zotero library

  •  In the plugin, enter a keyword into the search field (e.g., cats) and select an item from the list of search results.


4. Add the selected item to your Figma or FigJam layout

  • Confirm your selection and generate the citation.


Note: The plugin saves your credentials locally, so you do not need to enter this information every time you use it. However, you may need re-enter your credentials if you clear your cache. The plugin does not store your credentials anywhere on the web.


Feedback

How do you use this plugin? How would you like to use it? Any and all feedback is welcome. You can add comments as sticky notes to this FigJam board.


Roadmap

Future enhancements will be based on user feedback. A few ideas:

  • Add notes to a citation
  • Export an image of a source
  • Include tags from sources
  • Create a bibliography


Contribute

If you’d like to help develop this plugin, feel free to submit an issue or pull request. Code contributors should fork the repo and create a working branch for new changes. Once you’ve made changes, you can create a pull request for review.


GitHub repo: https://github.com/jamescoledesign/cite


Some useful guides for contributors:

  • Zotero Web API documentation
  • Figma Plugin API documentation
  • Example contribution guide: GitHub docs contributing guide


Contact

citeplugin@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Add citations from Zotero to your Figma and FigJam layouts

plugins.name: VariableScout
plugins.description:
VariableScout


The Essential Power Tool for Streamlined Variable Management. Effortlessly visualize, organize, and optimize your variables and nodes with various features designed to supercharge your workflow.


Core Features


  1. Variable Tracking: Comprehensive overview of all variables and their connections to nodes in your documents page
  2. Smart Filtering: Filter variables by type (Color, Number, Text, Boolean) and nodes by category (Components, Instances, Frames, Text, Shapes)
  3. Search System: Lightweight search functionality to quickly find specific variables, nodes, or collections
  4. Node Selection: Select individual nodes, multiple nodes, or entire path segments directly from the plugin to canvas
  5. Real-time Selection: Automatically updates to show variables connected to your selected nodes on canvas
  6. View Options: Only Unused Variables: Focus on variables not currently used in your document, Only Selected Nodes: Show variables only for nodes selected on canvas, Merge Collections: Combine all variables into a single, streamlined view, Hide Hidden Layers: Filter out variables connected to hidden layers, Focused View: Simplified display of variable values and node paths
  7. Customizable Export: Export your filtered and searched variables in JSON or CSV format - what you see is what you export
  8. Variable Swapping: Easily swap variables across multiple selected nodes simultaneously
  9. Collection Management: View and organize variables from both local and library collections


Key Benefits


  1. Time-Saving: Quick access to variable information and instant navigation to connected nodes on canvas
  2. Better Organization: Clear overview of variable usage and easy identification of unused variables
  3. Enhanced Workflow: Streamline variable management with automatic selection sync and multiple view options
  4. Project Clarity: Identify unused variables quickly, Focus on specific node selections, Clean up your document by finding hidden layer variables, Get a clear overview with merged or separated collections
  5. Team Efficiency: Share and manage variables across team libraries with intuitive collection organization
  6. Customizable Experience: Multiple view options to match your specific workflow needs
  7. Flexible Export: Export exactly what you need by applying filters, search, and view options before exporting
  8. Canvas Integration: Seamlessly navigate between plugin and canvas with bidirectional node selection


———


Please note:


The plugin is currently in Open Beta, which means it’s open to everyone to try for free during this testing period. This is an opportunity to explore all features, including VariableScout Pro functionalities, at no cost for a limited time.


As this is a beta version, some features might still be refined, and feedback is invaluable in helping improve it before the final release. Thank you for being part of this journey!


Loading collections and mapping variables to nodes for the first time may take longer than subsequent loads. Future loading times will be faster. Loading large collections (>2500 variables and/or 25000 Nodes) may take some time.
plugins.tagline: Visualize, organize, and optimize variables and nodes with features designed to boost your workflow.

plugins.name: Pixel Round
plugins.description:
Pixel Round is your go-to tool for achieving pixel-perfect precision in your Figma designs. Say goodbye to messy decimal values in dimensions, padding, text, and more. Pixel Round automatically rounds off values to the nearest whole number, ensuring your designs are always crisp, clean, and consistent.


How It Works:


  1. Install the Plugin: Start by adding Pixel Round to your Figma workspace.
  2. Select Your Frame or Element: Open the plugin and select a frame, group, component, or any design element that you want to perfect.
  3. Analyze the Selection: Pixel Round will instantly show a preview of your selection and check for any decimal issues in dimensions, padding, corner radii, stroke weights, text, and auto-layout settings.
  4. Click "Apply": The "Apply" button will round off all decimal values, including width, height, padding, corner radii, and stroke weight.
  5. Enjoy the Perfection: Once the process is complete, Pixel Round will notify you that your design is now pixel perfect!
plugins.tagline: Perfect your pixels effortlessly.

🔲Objects with Parents

plugins.name: fig2tw - Convert variables to Tailwind, CSS or JSON
plugins.description:
Convert Figma variables into a Tailwind plugin, CSS or JSON file.


Key features:

Tailwind configuration is inferred from the variable scopes.

Configure the variable scopes in Figma to generate useful Tailwind configuration.

<div class="bg-primary text-on-primary rounded-sm gap-md p-xs">
The background color is given by the variable "color/primary".
The text color is given by the variable "color/on primary".
The border-radius is given by the variable "radius/sm".
The gap is given by the variable "space/md".
The padding is given by the variable "space/xs".
</div>


All variable modes are converted into CSS variables.

Change the mode (light, dark, etc.) with a CSS class.

<div class="theme-light">Figma's light mode variables are applied here</div>
<div class="theme-dark">Figma's dark mode variables are applied here.</div>


Number units are configured by variable scope.

Define how numbers are to converted to CSS. You can choose from px, em, rem. Font weights don't have units.


Getting started:

1. Download the generated Tailwind plugin

Download the tailwind plugin using the "Download" button and place the file next to your tailwind.config.ts.


2. Import the generated plugin in your Tailwind configuration

In the tailwind.config.ts file, import the generated plugin and place it in the plugins array. The configuration should look like below.

import fig2tw from "tailwind.fig2tw";
const config = {
plugins: [fig2tw],
// ...
}
export default config;


Supports:

Tailwind configuration scopes:

colors, fill, accentColor, backgroundColor, gradientColorStops, borderColor, stroke, ringColor, ringOffsetColor, outlineColor, textColor, textDecorationColor, caretColor, placeholderColor, boxShadowColor.

spacing, size, width, minWidth, maxWidth, height, minHeight, maxHeight, margin, inset, borderRadius, padding, gap, space, scrollMargin, scrollPadding, borderSpacing, strokeWidth, outlineWidth, borderWidth, ringWidth, fontFamily, fontSize, lineHeight, letterSpacing, fontWeight


Figma variables scopes:

ALL_SCOPES, ALL_FILLS, FRAME_FILL, SHAPE_FILL, TEXT_FILL, STROKE_COLOR, EFFECT_COLOR, CORNER_RADIUS, WIDTH_HEIGHT, GAP, STROKE_FLOAT, FONT_SIZE, LINE_HEIGHT, LETTER_SPACING, FONT_WEIGHT, FONT_FAMILY
plugins.tagline: Convert variables into a Tailwind plugin, CSS or JSON

plugins.name: String-along
plugins.description:
Simplify content collaboration with a few clicks!


String-along makes managing string variables in your design projects a breeze, and with the release of version 2.0, we're taking your content collaboration to new heights. Building on our robust variable export and import capabilities, String-along 2.0 introduces a comprehensive suite of new features designed to enhance your workflow in Figma even further.


What's New in Version 2.0:


  • Advanced Manage Tab: A standout feature of 2.0, the Manage tab brings full string management to Figma. It automatically loads and categorizes all text elements on your current page, grouping them by their root frame for easy access, search, and more.


  • Text Node Search: Within the Manage tab, a unified fuzzy search feature allows you to filter by text content or variable name.


  • String Annotations: Add a status annotation to any text element, with options for both silent and visual annotations to suit your workflow needs. Then you can group the text nodes on the current page based on its annotated status.


  • Edit Text Nodes: Through the manage tab, you can edit text nodes, writing custom copy, or attaching them to existing or new string variables. This feature significantly enhances the plugin's utility for managing dynamic content across your projects and maximizes your ability to take advantage of string variables in Figma.


  • Bulk Editing: String-along 2.0 introduces bulk editing capabilities, enabling you to apply changes to multiple text elements simultaneously. Whether annotating, modifying text, or linking variables, these changes are reflected across all selected elements, saving you time and ensuring consistency.


Core Features Retained and Improved:


  • Export/Import String Variables: Export your string variables to a spreadsheet-compatible format, make edits or translations, and import them back into Figma with ease.


  • Flexible Delimiter Support: Customizable delimiter options adapt to your preferred format, ensuring seamless integration with any spreadsheet software.


  • Preview Changes: Before finalizing imports, preview your changes in a tabular format, highlighting updated values for clarity.


  • Comprehensive Format Support: String-along continues to support a wide range of formatting options, including line breaks and punctuation, for versatile string management.
plugins.tagline: Complete suit of content management tools with full string variable support
